Gameplay Applications

This module challenges you to take what you have learned about mechanics and metrics and apply it to the development and iteration of an analogue game. Emphasis is placed on originality, polish and balance. To achieve this, it is expected that you will go through an iterative process of design, test and redesign of your game at least once every ten days (8 tests per semester), recording feedback on your game and then immediately making changes to it.

Learning Objectives:

+  Analyse researched information in order to plan a project that fulfils the identified needs of a modern game.

+  Evaluate the appropriateness of choices and varied approaches to solving problems that occur during the preparation and presentation of gameplay mechanics.

+  Determine game characteristics and mechanics in order to select appropriate tools and methods required to support the design and development of a rapid prototype game.

+  Plan and create an analogue game that utilises the correct documentation

+  Review the project creation process evaluating the effectiveness of your role during the project.
